intro: Cirsium elbrusense, commonly known as the Elbrus thistle, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its spiny, upright stems and large, purple to pinkish-purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cirsium elbrusense is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other thistle and daisy species.
